data.meta_description: Looking to get from Oslo Airport to Drammen, when travelling in Norway? AtoB has got all the information you need in our brand new guide! Enjoy!
data.text:
Is There a Oslo Airport to Drammen Train?

To travel from Oslo Airport to Drammen by train, follow these simple steps. First, upon arrival at Oslo Airport, locate the train station, which is conveniently situated within the airport complex. Next, purchase a train ticket to Drammen from one of the self-service ticket machines or the ticket counter. The ticket price may vary depending on factors such as the time of travel and class selection, but will usually cost around 150 NOK, or just over 10 euro.

Once you have your ticket, proceed to the designated platform for the train heading to Drammen (R12, R13, or RE11). Trains from Oslo Airport to Drammen operate frequently, ensuring you have several options throughout the day. The duration of the train journey typically ranges between 30 to 45 minutes, offering a quick and convenient mode of transportation. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the scenic views as you make your way to Drammen.

Getting a Bus from Oslo Airport to Drammen

When traveling from Oslo Airport to Drammen, opting for the bus route offers a convenient alternative. Upon arrival, locate the bus terminal situated just outside the airport’s arrival hall. Seek out the guidance of airport staff or follow the clear signage available to ease your way. Acquire a bus ticket for your desired destination, Drammen, either from the ticket counter or the automated vending machines at the terminal. Bus fares present a cost-effective choice, rendering it a budget-friendly option, with prices usually ranging around 100 NOK, or the equivalent of 7 euro.

Expect a variable duration for the bus journey, as it is subject to traffic conditions, typically averaging between 60 to 75 minutes. The bus schedules are meticulously crafted to cater to a range of travel times, ensuring flexibility to accommodate your plans. Settle into a comfortable seat aboard the bus and relish the captivating vistas unfolding before your eyes as you traverse towards the captivating city of Drammen.

Transport from Oslo Airport To Drammen Various Options

Up to this point, we have seen the two public transport options you have available to you, so now, let’s look over the few private options you have, namely car hire, a standard taxi cab, or a private transfer with AtoB.

For car hires, you will likely appreciate the flexibility of being able to travel at your own pace, in your own car. There are a few issues that arise with renting a car, though. The first, and most prominent, is the issue of navigating and parking. Although GPS is available almost everywhere now, it can still be tricky to get around in a foreign country, plus finding parking, especially in a large city is a nightmare. The second issue is the insurance waiver, which, although you will get back, can still be a big spend at the beginning of a trip, leaving you out of pocket before your trip has even begun.

Now, on to standard taxis. Landing at the airport, heading outside and whistling down a taxi sounds like a really easy way to get to your destination, right? Sure, although in reality it won’t be as simple. The first issue is the amount of other travellers who will have a similar idea. Oslo Airport is very large, and has numerous passengers travelling through it every day. You will likely be delayed when trying to hail a taxi. Let’s say you get one though, you may find the price a bit steep, as taxi drivers at the airport will choose to include a number of other “charges” in the final price, which you will need to pay on the spot.

To avoid all of these issues, book a private transfer with AtoB. We offer a fixed price, no insurance waiver, and an immediate pickup from the airport. Sounds awesome?

Cheapest Way from Oslo Airport to Drammen

Before we get into discussing how to book AtoB’s service, let’s first talk a bit about the cheapest method for travelling between the two destinations. As we saw above, the prices for either of the public transport offerings are affordable, yet the downside they have is firstly that they may not fit with your travelling schedule, and second, they may be slightly uncomfortable, especially for those travelling with a lot of luggage or children.

Large groups, as well as those with lots of luggage will find the AtoB service both affordable, as well as comfortable and convenient. If you calculate the price per passenger, you will find that our vans usually come out to be cheaper!

Booking a Transfer from Oslo Airport to Drammen with AtoB

Booking an Oslo to Drammen airport taxi with AtoB will most likely be the simplest thing you’ve done today – guaranteed! To begin, go to our booking platform and begin the process. You will then be asked to choose your destination and provide your trip information, such as pick-up date, departure time, and pick-up and drop-off sites. The next step is to decide whether you want an economy, business, or luxury first-class vehicle.

For larger groups, a variety of van choices are available. After you’ve finished these steps, make sure to include as many add-ons as you need before heading to the checkout page, where you can pay securely with a credit or debit card. When your money is successfully processed, you will receive an email with the booking details and a reference number. All you have to do is arrive on time and you will be greeted by a courteous driver who will safely transport you to your destination. See, we told you it was going to be simple!
